content:
I'm happy to help you with your question! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to specific information about individual stores or their promotions. But I can give you some general advice and clarify the discount concept for you!

It's always a good idea to call ahead or check the store's website or social media pages to inquire about any promotions or discounts they might be offering, especially for first-time customers. You can also ask about any loyalty programs or email newsletters that might provide exclusive offers.

Now, about discounts: when an item is discounted by 20%, it means you'll pay 80% of the original price, but that's not exactly how the math works. Here's the correct calculation:

Original price = $100
Discount = 20% of $100 = $20
Discounted price = $100 - $20 = $80

So, in this case, you'd pay $80, which is 80% of the original price ($100). Make sense?

Remember to always check the prices and any discounts carefully before making a purchase, and don't hesitate to ask the store staff if you have any questions. Happy thrifting!
